info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 20 at 8:05PM EDT until July 21 at 1:00AM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EDT FOR MCDUFFIE...COLUMBIA...SOUTHEASTERN LINCOLN...RICHMOND... EDGEFIELD...WESTERN AIKEN...SOUTHWESTERN SALUDA AND SOUTHEASTERN MCCORMICK COUNTIES... At 804 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles east of Troy to near Thomson-McDuffie County Airport to 7 miles northeast of Sparta, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 to 70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. This storm has had a history of knocking down trees. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. Locations impacted include... Aiken, North Augusta, Grovetown, Evans, Thomson, Fort Gordon, Augusta, Clearwater, Martinez, Belvedere, Edgefield, Hephzibah, Harlem, Johnston, Jackson, Ridge Spring, Glendale, South Augusta, Clarks Hill Recreation Area and Edgefield County Airport. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in Georgia between mile markers 173 and 201. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 0 and 25. Interstate 520 in Georgia between mile markers 1 and 15. Interstate 520 in South Carolina between mile markers 16 and 23. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection seek shelter inside a sturdy building and stay away from windows. Severe thunderstorms can produce large capsizing waves and frequent lightning. If on or near Lake Strom Thurmond move away from the water and take shelter!
